text: Assertion: The charge on body can be increased or decreased in terms of electronic charge e. Reason: Quantisation of charge means that the charge on a body is the integral multiple of electronic  charge e.

options.a: If both assertion and reason are true and reason is the correct explanation of assertion
options.b: If both assertion and reason are true but reason is not the correct explanation of assertion
options.c: If assertion is true but reason is false
options.d: If both assertion and reason are false

hint: All the observable charges have to be integral multiple of e. Thus if a body contains <math><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> electrons and <math><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> protons, the total amount of charge on the body is <math><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>e + <math><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>(-e) = (<math><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> â€“ <math><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>) e. Since <math><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> are integers, their difference is also an integer. Thus the charge on anybody is always an integral multiple of e and can be increased or decreased in terms of e.
